report_title: Industry Report on Paint and Sip Studios
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Paint and sip studios offer painting classes and serve wine and other alcoholic beverages. Unlike traditional fine arts classes, paint and sip studios focus on providing a recreational and leisure experience for their customers. These studios have benefited from the growing demand for social activities. Many participate in paint and sip studios with their friends or colleagues. Many corporations have included paint and sip studios as one of the after-work activities for their employees. However, the industry suffered from the social distancing amid COVID-19. As a result, industry revenue fell an annualized 0.2% to $148.0 million over the five years to 2024, including a 1.3% decline in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Paint and Sip is a New Form of Entertainment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Further, the affordable price point of industry service, ranging from $30.00 to $35.00 on average, helps boost industry demand. Paint and sip studios have emerged as a new form of recreational and educational classes in which customers can enjoy time with their companions while gaining some art skills. Customers are provided with all the supplies, and they can take their artwork home as a souvenir. Some studios even let customers bring their drinks. The relaxed and fun environment at industry establishments is expected to be the key selling point for paint and sip studios over the coming years.

Over the past five years, the industry benefited from an increase in leisure time and per capita disposable income. However, the industry's prime customer group, adults aged 20 to 64 has stagnated. Total recreation expenditure has increased over the past five years as customers value the benefits of recreational activities.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Makes Up a Large Share of Franchised Establishments
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry is made up of a large number of franchise chains such as Painting With a Twist, Pinot's Palette and Wine and Design. These chains have more than 100 locations across the country and are continually expanding. However, they only have a few company-owned locations and more than 90.0% of their locations are franchised. Therefore, these establishments are not considered industry-relevant. As demand continues to grow, industry operators have consistently added more locations to their portfolio.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: When more people return to work from working-from-home arrangements, their available time for leisure and recreational activities has declined accordingly. As customers become time-strapped, they will be less likely to frequent industry establishments, thus hurting industry demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Paint and Sip Studios Find Ways to Draw New Customers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Paint and sip studios must emphasize the fun and entertaining experience they can provide to attract new customers. Although less popular, many operators are introducing virtual paint and sip sessions, targeting remote customers.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry offer painting classes and serve wine and other alcoholic beverages.

threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Price is a key competitive base. Consumers usually attend paint and sip studios as a hobby, so keeping prices low is the best way to prevent losses in attendance when per capita disposable income falls.
Reputation brings in students. Some schools accomplish this by having a famous founder.
Paint and sip studios fared well thanks to the increasing demand for social activities. Students attending paint and sip studios can spend their leisure time while acquiring a new skill.
The industry is expected to blossom in the future after recovering strongly from the pandemic. Higher-income and strong demand for recreational education activities will support industry growth.

Fluctuations in leisure time availability can weigh on demand for paint and sip studios. While customers earn more income through employment, they also have less leisure time to participate and paint and sip classes.
Many paint and sip studios have offered themed events by collaborating with popular brands. Besides, they also provide team-building events to business customers.
Industry profit declined significantly amid the pandemic. However, some studios mitigated revenue losses by offering virtual classes.
Wages represent the industry's largest cost. Besides art skills, instructors must provide students with an enjoyable atmosphere.
The industry's main income source is paint and sip classes. Besides, they also retail artists' artwork and host exhibitions.
Age limit on alcohol consumption restricts demand from customers under 25. Likewise, health concerns also reduce demand from customers over 65 years old.
Some studio chains gain market share by expanding franchise operations. New entrants become a franchisee to lower barriers to entry.
The industry is consumer-facing. Most consumers will only choose local paint and sip studios.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Age limits on alcohol consumption restrict demand for most customers in this age group. Also, many customers in this age group are just recently graduated and at the start of their career, pressuring their ability to splurge on pain and sip classes.

These customers are likely to have a steady income stream. Moreover, the older individuals in this age group are established in their career, enabling them to spend on discretionary services such as paint and sip classes. These customers also have a high demand for social activities. They can join paint and sip studios with their friends, families and colleagues.

Many customers over 55 have ailments that restrict them from consuming alcohol, partly reducing demand for paint and sip studios. Also, many may lack the strength to attend paint and sip studios. Besides, the older consumers in this group often live in senior care communities or retirement homes, so there is little need for the social benefits paint and sip studios bring.

products_and_services.product_description: Paint and sip studios' core offerings are paint classes. They also provide all painting materials, refreshments, and beverages. Each class usually takes one hour, and customers can take home their paintings. Some studios also allow Bring-Your-Own wines.
Many studios retail their artists's paintings or on behalf of other artists. Paint and sip studios also host exhibitions and offer short-term space rentals to other artists and customers.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Rental of Space for Short-Term Use

tier_1_suppliers: Office Supply Stores in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
Copier & Office Equipment Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Industry demand is heavily influenced by the time spent on leisure activities as customers frequent paint and sip studios for recreational purposes rather than educational purposes. A fall in leisure time will pose a potential challenge to the industry.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Revenue Volatility is high. Industry Assistance is low and steady.
Life Cycle Stage is growth. Concentration Level is low. Technology Change Level is low. Globalization Level is low but increasing. Competition Level is low but increasing.

factors_increased_barrier: Industry Assistance is low and steady
factors_decreased_barrier: Globalization Level is low but increasing
Competition Level is low but increasing

basis_points.basis_description: Price is a key competitive base. Consumers usually attend paint and sip studios as a hobby, so keeping prices low is the best way to prevent losses in attendance when per capita disposable income falls.
Reputation brings in students. Some schools accomplish this by having a famous founder.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages Account for the Highest Share of the Industry's Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The labor costs include wages paid to artists. However, artists working in industry studios are not required to be well-known to lead a class, keeping wages' share of revenue moderate.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue is dependent on income and leisure time
volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue is dependent on income and leisure time. Employment determines income levels and can move in the opposite direction with leisure time. When individuals have a full-time job, their leisure time availability will decline. Paint and sip sessions are highly discretionary, therefore, they require both leisure time and income to attend.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Virtual Paint and Sip Studios Have Become More Popular
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Although many customers value the in-person aspects of paint and sip studios, many also opt for online classes. These classes fared better during COVID-19 when everyone practiced social distancing. However, the flexibility of online courses still attracts an increasing number of customers.

FAQs.question: What factors affect revenue volatility in the paint and sip industry?
FAQs.answer: Revenue is dependent on income and leisure time. Employment determines income levels and can move in the opposite direction with leisure time. Paint and sip sessions are highly discretionary, requiring both leisure time and income to attend.

FAQs.question: What is the level of regulation and policy impact on the paint and sip industry?
FAQs.answer: The text mentions two possible levels of regulation and policy impact: 1) Low regulation, and 2) Steady regulation.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance for the paint and sip industry?
FAQs.answer: The text mentions two possible levels of industry assistance: 1) Low assistance, and 2) Steady assistance.
